description:
## Purpose
This layer presents monthly traffic volumes mapped to road segments of the GIP graph and primarily serves the validation and calibration of HFLB-based mobility data using available reference measurements. This establishes a basis for further mobility analyses, correlation with EO-based environmental and air quality indicators, and spatially differentiated assessment and scenario analyses.

## Data Sources
Two complementary datasets are used in this analysis:
- ASFINAG Traffic Count Data (2019–2021)
Monthly average daily traffic values (Monday–Sunday), provided as the indicator DTVMS.
These data are available only for road segments equipped with stationary traffic counting sensors.
- HFLB Mobility Data (2019–2021)
Network-wide mobility information based on High Frequency Location Based (HFLB) data with daily temporal resolution, covering all road segments of the high-level road network.
Traffic volumes are represented by the variable trajectories (max) and describe relative traffic intensities.

## Method
Monthly traffic volumes from both datasets are mapped to the road segments of the GIP graph and directly compared.
As HFLB data do not represent absolute traffic counts, a scaling procedure is applied using ASFINAG reference measurements:
- The monthly total traffic volume derived from the HFLB data is adjusted to match the corresponding total volume observed in the ASFINAG traffic counts.
- The resulting scaling factor is location-independent and is applied uniformly to all road segments.
- This process yields the variable HFLB Scaled, representing a calibrated estimate of monthly traffic volumes.
This approach enables a consistent calibration of HFLB data despite the limited spatial coverage and monthly temporal resolution of the reference traffic counts.

## Visualization and Interaction
The layer visualizes monthly traffic volumes for individual road segments.
Upon selecting a road segment on the map, time series of traffic volumes (ASFINAG DTVMS, HFLB trajectories (max), and HFLB Scaled) are displayed in a line chart.
This allows for direct comparison between datasets, assessment of temporal consistency and deviations, and transparent interpretation of the applied scaling procedure at segment level.
title: Monthly traffic volume
